dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4656 IH: Caring for America's Heroes Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Gardner (for himself and Mrs. Capps) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to improve access to mental health services under the TRICARE program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Caring for America's Heroes Act.

section.header: Improvement of access to mental health services under the TRICARE program

subsection.header: Elimination of limit on days of inpatient services
subsection.text: Section 1079 of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (7) through (17) as paragraphs (6) through (16), respectively;

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (j) through (q) as subsections (i) through (p), respectively.

subsection.header: Repeal of requirement for nonavailability statement or preauthorization
subsection.text: Section 721(a) of the Floyd D. Spence National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2001 (10 U.S.C. 1073 note) is amended by striking (other than mental health services).
Chapter 55 of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 1079(e)(7), by striking subsection (a)(13) and inserting subsection (a)(12);

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d)(4)(A)(ii), by striking section 1079(j)(1) and inserting section 1079(i)(1); and
in subsection (g), by striking Section 1079(j) and inserting Section 1079(i); and

paragraph.text: in section 1105(c), by striking section 1079(a)(7) and inserting section 1079(a)(6).
